name: 1,3-bis[tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino]propane
Reason: 1,3-Bis[tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino]propane has a melting point that is influenced by several structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 3-methylbutane, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion raises the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. Additionally, the hydroxymethyl group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at approximately +20°C. The tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at approximately +30°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at approximately +20°C.
